meanings.definition: To make (something) more like a republic.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was republicanizing the classroom by encouraging student democracy.
meanings.sent2: The town council was republicanizing the local government structure.
meanings.sent3: The children were republicanizing their game by voting for rules.
meanings.sent4: The artist was republicanizing the art community with inclusive exhibitions.
meanings.sent5: The chef was republicanizing the menu by adding dishes from various cultures.

meanings.definition: To convert (someone) to republican beliefs or principles.
meanings.sent1: She was republicanizing her friend by discussing the benefits of democracy.
meanings.sent2: The activist was republicanizing the community through open discussions.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly accused his brother of republicanizing him during their political debates.
meanings.sent4: The speaker was republicanizing the audience with persuasive arguments.
meanings.sent5: The book was republicanizing readers with its compelling narrative about freedom.
